findings.title: Coinbase inflation
findings.description: When proof-of-stake mining is enabled, value of reward in coinbase is not validated which allows to generate any number of new coins.

findings.title: Duplicated transactions
findings.description: It is possible to include the same transaction in more than one block due to improper validation of coinbase transactions in proof-of-stake mode.

findings.title: Invalid transaction time
findings.description: A transaction with nVersion > 1 has a new field, nTime, that contains the timestamp of when a transaction was created. It is being verified incorrectly.

findings.title: Transaction malleability
findings.description: The transaction `nTime` field is not cryptographically secured and can be modified by anyone, allowing manipulation of proof-of-stake consensus.

findings.title: Block DoS
findings.description: A node able to mine a new block can generate an infinite number of new, valid blocks causing a denial of service.

findings.title: Block header DoS
findings.description: In proof-of-stake mining, it is impossible to validate whether the block header is valid or not. Anyone can generate an infinite number of new block headers, causing a denial of service attack.

findings.title: Incorrect stake modifier cache
findings.description: The cache may return different results for different active_chainstate, especially when validating a new chain forking from some older block, which can lead to accepting an invalid block or rejecting a valid one.

findings.title: Coinstake DoS
findings.description: Out-of-bounds array read in CheckProofOfStake function can crash the application.

findings.title: Invalid block synchronization
findings.description: Block field `vchBlockSig` containing the block signature is not transferred when a block is synchronized using CMPCTBLOCK.

findings.title: Invalid block validation
findings.description: Proof-of-stake block may be set as valid even when it has an invalid signature.

findings.title: CBlockIndex exception
findings.description: The strprintf function will always throw a tiny format exception because the number of parameters is greater than the number of parameters required by the format string.

findings.title: Usage of floating point arithmetic
findings.description: Floating point arithmetic used by consensus may work differently on various platforms.

findings.title: Slow GetLastBlockIndex
findings.description: Function `GetLastBlockIndex` has O(n) complexity where n is a number of blocks, it may be very slow in the future.

findings.title: Long range and grinding attack against consensus
findings.description: Indxcoin's proof of stake consensus implementation is vulnerable to long range and grinding attacks, allowing an attacker with a very low stake (less than 0.01% of all existing coins) to potentially perform such an attack.

findings.title: Out-of-bounds read (denial of service)
findings.description: In function CheckProofOfStake, an out-if-bonds array read can crash the application.
